snippet: Pressed by shooting victims and relatives of Americans slain in gun violence, the Senate voted to consider new legislation that had faced the threat of a filibuster by Republicans.
abstract: Senate, pressed by shooting victims and relatives of Americans slain in gun violence, votes 63-31 to begin debate on gun safety proposals as advocates of new laws overcome Republican filibuster threat; strong majority in favor of considering expansion of background checks and increasing penalties for illegal gun sales reflects power of lobbying campaign by parents of students killed in Newton, Conn, and others.
lead_paragraph: Pressed by shooting victims and relatives of Americans slain in gun violence, the Senate voted to consider new legislation that had faced the threat of a filibuster by Republicans.

headline.main: Senators Agree to Start Debate on Gun Safety Measures
headline.print_headline: Senators Agree To Start Debate On Gun Limits
